Procs

proc getIpInfo(ip: string): JsonNode {...}{.raises: [IOError, KeyError, ValueError,
    JsonParsingError, Exception, HttpRequestError, SslError, TimeoutError,
    ProtocolError], tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}

getIpInfo

use ip-api.com free service limited to abt 250 requests/min

exceeding this you will need to unlock your wan ip manually at their site

the JsonNode is returned for further processing if needed

and can be queried like so

var jj = getIpInfo("208.80.152.201")
for x in mpairs(jj):
   echo x
echo()
echo jj["city"].getstr
proc getWanIP(): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect].}

getWanIP

using curl and ifconfig to get the wanip alternatively use getWanIp2() . 

proc getWanIp2(): string {...}{.raises: [],
                        tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}

getWanIP2

get your wanip from api.ipify.org if curl and/or ifconfig not installed 

proc showIpInfo(ip: string) {...}{.raises: [IOError, ValueError], tags: [ReadIOEffect,
    WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect, ReadEnvEffect].}

showIpInfo

Displays details for a given IP

Example:

showIpInfo("208.80.152.201")
showIpInfo(getHosts("bbc.com")[0])

    discardable, raises: [OSError, Exception, IOError, ValueError], tags: [
    ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect, ReadEnvEffect].}

pingy

small utility to ping some server

pingy("yahoo.com",4,dodgerblue)   # 4 pings and display progress in some color
pingy("google.com",8,aqua)
pingy("ping.sunet.se",4,lime)
proc cxPortCheck(cmd: string = "lsof -i") {...}{.raises: [IOError, ValueError, OSError,
    Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect,
                     RootEffect].}

cxPortCheck

shows the list of all network connections which are

listening and established.

This runs a linux system command to see what the ports are listening to

if no or partial output at all run your program with sudo 

proc cxDig(ipadd: string): tuple

cxDig

returns reverse DNS of an ip address

needs dig command available on system

may or may not return expected data

see showDig() for display 

proc cxDns(dns: string): tuple

cxDns

also see showHosts() 

proc showDig(hostip: string = $"172.217.5.14") {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, OSError, Exception, ValueError],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect].}

showDig

reverse dns lookup , default a google ip

proc showDns(hostdns: string = "google.com") {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, OSError, Exception, ValueError], tags: [WriteIOEffect,
    ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, ReadEnvEffect].}

showDns

ip and connected hosts look up for a domain name

default = google.com

showDns("bbc.com")
proc getHosts(dm: string): seq[string] {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}

getHosts

returns IP addresses inside a seq[string] for a domain name and

may resolve multiple IP pointing to same domain

import nimcx
var z = getHosts("bbc.co.uk")
for x in z:
  echo x
doFinish()
proc showHosts(dm: string) {...}{.raises: [IOError, ValueError],
                          tags: [WriteIOEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect].}

showHosts

displays IP addresses for a domain name and

may resolve multiple IP pointing to same domain

import nimcx
showHosts("bbc.co.uk")
doFinish()

                  tags: [ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect].}
